content: Oh a mate this is dmg you were gonna make bottles and tankard
okay so we're gonna make bottles and tankards in this episode it's going to
be a little bit messy but you know this is with basic tools so grab a drinking
straw and we're gonna cut it was all about a mirror one centimeter ish and
just continue that on and as many bottles you want to make that's how many
you cut and then we're also going to make the tankards at the moment so
they're just going to be a little bit short about two-thirds of the length of
the bottles so that's probably going to be about 2/3 of a centimeter and then
we're gonna get some green Goblin's splattered blood and red paint and dip
in a brush and just paint the inside of the bottle ones so you can use whatever
colors you really want to use for this the contents of the bottle so you know
you can mix up the greens mix up the reds add in some blues if you wanted to
for wines or ales or yellows or whites whatever you like this is just to show
the difference when we're actually crafting these so apply them as you want
that doesn't have to cover it 100% and obviously you know do a variation so
you've got a few different bottles to go with and you'll see here that the paint
does sort of start to streak or pull away with the meniscus of the paint and
so expect that to happen so now what we're going to do is grab a toothpick
and place one of the bottles standing up on the parchment paper which is baking
paper and hot glue just let it grab it let gravity do the work and drop it into
there and you're probably going to have to deal with wisps and then push the
toothpick into that so the toothpick is actually going to form the cork in the
top of the bottle and also helps us do this part where we
can then just use a little bit of glue around the top to form the top curve of
the bottle and then use the nozzle the heat of the hot nozzle of the glue gun
to shape the hot glue while it's curing to get the right shape that you want and
clean up the bottom so this one was a little bit raggedy on the bottom so just
put some hot glue on there and just stick it straight back down onto the
parchment paper to flatten it out and once it's cured you can just push down
on that on the toothpick and cut off the the remaining of the toothpick as you
can see with a different bottle just cut off the remaining so you've just got
enough left to indicate the cork and that's really what it's going to be
looking like at this point so from here we want to add a label so what I did was
I grabbed this sort of whiteout it's a it's like a whiteout tape I found it in
a drawl I have no idea where one buys the sort of stuff over seam and just
being a in a I don't know it's still it from your office cupboard and so this
you can push out a few and see which ones get you a nice straight put a dab
of hot glue on top of it and roll one of your bottles over it and that will make
that nice little white label stick to the actual bottle surface like that and
then later on you and your some texture or something to write or make it look
like a label so now onto the tankards so we're going to grab the straws that we
use for the tickets and we're going to get just about 2/3 of that length in
bits of toothpick so just cut off the bits of toothpick and then grab one of
the tankards and the tiny little blob of hot glue on the side of that again
careful the wisps and grab one of those pieces of the toothpick and stick it on
so that must be towards the very top of flush with the top of the tankard create
as many as you want and then put a blob of hot glue on
the parchment baking paper and push the base of the tankard into that and once
that is cured you can pull that off or if the cooties that look messy you can
just use another toothpick just cleaned it up as I did there and just keep as
many tankards as you want just keep putting blobs down and pushing those
tankards into it so once it's cured to pull it off and there you go you've got
the tankard base there and you can tied it up with a bit of pair of scissors and
then it's a matter of just grabbing your favorite silver or copper or whatever
paint or of course you can use yellow or white what are the colors you really
like and that's it so that's how you make bottles and tankards now if you
like this video that's right click it you will enjoy it
